definition: exhibiting indirect causation, connection, or relation
examples: the disease spreads by mediate as well as direct contact

definition: to bring accord out of by action as an intermediary (see intermediary entry 1 sense 1a)
examples: endeavored to mediate East-West differences on several important issues

definition: to effect by action as an intermediary (see intermediary entry 1 sense 1a)
examples: mediated a settlement that was satisfactory to both sides

definition: to act as intermediary (see intermediary entry 2 sense 2) agent in bringing, effecting, or communicating : convey
examples: individuals … mediate the culture to the child

definition: to transmit as intermediate mechanism or agency
to interpose between parties in order to reconcile (see reconcile sense 1a) them
